awards.title: Chemistry Graduate Student Mentorship Award
awards.awarder: Carnegie Mellon University Deparment of Chemistry
awards.summary: The Graduate Student Teaching Award celebrates teaching assistant who have shown consistent excellence over at least four semesters, with strong teaching in labs or recitations, creative teaching methods and a commitment to inclusive practices.

awards.title: Outstanding Chemistry Graduate Student Aware
awards.awarder: Texas State Deparment of Chemistry & Biochemistry
awards.summary: The Outstanding Graduate Student Awards are presented each April at the Graduate Student Awards Ceremony. The award highlights one master's and one doctoral student from each college who has shown tremendous talent, effort, and ingenuity in their graduate studies..

publications.name: Machine learning-accelerated screening of hydroquinone analogs for proton-coupled electron transfer
publications.summary: We used the AIMNet2 neural network to rapidly predict thermochemical properties (BDFE values) for ~200,000 hydroquinone-like molecules, revealing how backbone and N-substitution systematically tune PCET reactivity and validating the model with experimental data.

publications.name: Oxidation of C-H and O-H Bonds by a Copper Complex Inspired by the Cu(II)-Tyrosyl Species Formed in LPMO
publications.summary: We report the first example of Cu complex supported by a redox-active ligand capable of oxidizing C–H bonds via proton-coupled electron transfer, revealing mechanistic parallels to Cu-dependent metalloenzymes and highlighting the role of non-thermodynamic factors in PCET reactivity.

publications.name: Synthesis and Characterization of Copper Complexes Featuring a Redox-Active ONO Ligand in Three Molecular Oxidation States
publications.summary: We synthesized and characterized a family of Cu complexes with a redox-active ONO ligand that undergo reversible ligand-centered redox transformations across three oxidation states, providing evidence of how Cu–radical systems might tune their electronic structure to control reactivity.

publications.name: Enhanced Proton-Coupled Electron-Transfer Reactivity by a Mononuclear Nickel(II) Hydroxide Radical Complex
publications.summary: We developed a NiOH complex supported by a redox-active ligand that accesses three oxidation states and promotes PCET reactivity, revealing that unique stereoelectronic factors such as radical character and basicity may enhance H-atom abstraction kinetics.

publications.name: C–H functionalization reactions promoted by 1st row transition metals with redox-active ligands. Nature did it first
publications.summary: We review key examples of C–H functionalization catalyzed by 3d metal complexes that harness redox-active ligands, oxidants, and substrates relevant to the chemistry of natural metalloenzymes.

publications.name: Electroactive Polymer-Based Spray Ionization for Direct Mass Spectrometric Analysis
publications.publisher: Journal of the American Society for Mass Spectrometry
publications.summary: We developed an electroactive polymer–based spray ionization method that enables rapid, miniaturized mass spectrometry with sample volumes as low as 0.1 μL, achieving up to 100-fold improved detection limits over paper spray for pharmaceuticals and peptides.

publications.name: A 4H+/4e– Electron-Coupled-Proton Buffer Based on a Mononuclear Cu Complex
publications.publisher: Journal of the American Chemical Society
publications.summary: We developed a Cu-based 4H⁺/4e⁻ electron–coupled proton buffer that mediates both decoupled and coupled redox reactions—including catalytic O₂ reduction to water—by cycling between ligand-centered oxidation states via fast disproportionation.

publications.name: Enabling Conducting Polymer Applications: Methods for Achieving High Molecular Weight in Chemical Oxidative Polymerization in Alkyl- and Ether-Substituted Thiophenes
publications.summary: We showed that optimizing FeCl₃-mediated polymerization conditions by tailoring solvent and reagent addition significantly improves molecular weight in ether-substituted polythiophenes.

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: uv_pro is a feature-rich command line tool for processing UV-Vis data built for speed and ease of use. I developed uv_pro to overcome the limitations of the software which came with my lab's UV-vis spectrometer. This was a fun opportunity to hone my Python skills and create a useful tool for my team. Two years and and tens of thousands of spectra later, it has served me and my colleagues well.
